Key Arguments: The legislation threatens freedom of speech, which is a fundamental part of Australian democracy.
Governments, being fallible, should not be the arbiters of misinformation and disinformation.
The legislation could lead to censorship, with social media platforms erring on the side of caution.
There is a risk of misuse of power if a malign government comes to power.
There is a perceived double standard where the government and mainstream media are exempt from censorship.
Notable Quotes: For the first time in my life I feel afraid of my government.
It is offensive that we the people may be censored for what we say, but the government and MSM be exempt!
I fear if this law passes that Social Media entities will err on the side of caution, and censure posts deemed only borderline controversial.
